Pengusaha Minta Dirjen Pajak Baru Genjot Perluasan Subjek Pajak
01 Nov 2019, 13:50 by Caesar Akbar, Dewi Rina Cahyani
Tempo.Co, Jakarta - Ketua Bidang Perpajakan Asosiasi Pengusaha Indonesia Siddhi Widyaprathama berharap Direktur Jenderal Pajak yang baru saja dilantik, Suryo Utomo melakukan ekstensifikasi atau perluasan subjek pajak dalam beberapa waktu ke depan.
"Kami mendukung extra effort bersifat ekstensifikasi berupa perluasan subjek pajak," ujar Siddhi di Kantor Kementerian Keuangan, Jakarta, Jumat, 1 November 2019. Ia mendorong Direktorat Jenderal Pajak untuk melakukan upaya kepada warga negara yang belum memiliki Nomor Pokok Wajib Pajak.
Soal pendapatan perpajakan yang cenderung melesu beberapa waktu terakhir, Siddhi memahaminya. Sebab di lain pihak dunia usaha juga tengah mengalami tekanan. "Jadi sama-sama mengalami tekanan."
Siddhi pun berharap Suryo bisa menyelesaikan beberapa pekerjaan yang belum diselesaikan Dirjen Pajak sebelumnya, Robert Pakpahan. Misalnya saja pada reformasi perpajakan dan peraturan perundang-undangan. Ia pun menunggu rampungnya RUU Omnibus Law.
Ihwal persoalan shortfall yang selama ini kerap terjadi, Siddhi menyarankan Suryo dan jajarannya melakukan profiling. Sehingga, dari langkah tersebut dapat dilihat sektor usaha yang belum tercakup dan kepatuhannya rendah serta bagaimana pendekatannya.
Di samping itu, ia pun mengusulkan agar target penerimaan perpajakan dibuat berdasarkan angka yang sudah dicapai. "Bukan target tahun lalu dinaikkan lagi," ujar Siddhi.
Adapun Suryo Utomo mengatakan langkah pertama yang bakal diambil di awal masa jabatannya adalah melakukan konsolidasi. "Kami konsolidasi dulu lah kira-kira akan seperti apa," ujar dia selepas pelantikan di Kantor Kementerian Keuangan.
Suryo mengatakan akan tetap melanjutkan pekerjaan dari periode Direktur Jenderal Pajak sebelumnya. Namun, ia juga akan melakukan pemetaan kembali untuk melihat kebijakan atau langkah-langkah apa saja yang bisa dipercepat.
Di samping itu, Suryo mengatakan pekerjaan yang mesti dilakukan dalam waktu dekat juga adalah menjaga dan menggenjot target-target sektor pajak hingga akhir tahun 2019. "Itu yang di depan mata, action dan effort lah akan kami lakukan."
Selain itu, Suryo juga akan memacu perampungan RUU Omnibus Law pajak. Saat ini, kemajuan perancangan beleid tersebut, menurut dia, masih ada harmonisasi sehingga ada hal yang perlu ditulis ulang lagi. Ia berharap diskusi dan harmonisasi itu bisa segera rampung sebelum disampaikan kepada Presiden Joko Widodo. "InsyaAllah (selesai tahun depan), kan kami harapkan itu kalau tidak ada masalah bisa selesai cepat," ujar Suryo.

Entrepreneurs Ask New Director General of Taxes to Boost Tax Subject Expansion
01 Nov 2019, 13:50 by Caesar Akbar, Dewi Rina Cahyani
Tempo.Co, Jakarta - Chairperson of Taxation of the Indonesian Employers Association Siddhi Widyaprathama hopes that the newly appointed Director General of Tax Suryo Utomo extends or extends the subject of taxes in the future.
"We support the extra effort of extensification in the form of expanding the subject of taxes," said Siddhi at the Ministry of Finance Office, Jakarta, Friday, November 1, 2019. He encouraged the Directorate General of Taxes to make efforts for citizens who do not yet have a Taxpayer Identification Number.
Regarding tax revenue which has tended to slow down in recent times, Siddhi understands it. Because on the other hand the business world is also experiencing pressure. "So you're both under pressure."
Siddhi also hopes that Suryo can complete some work that has not been completed by the Director General of Taxes, Robert Pakpahan. For example, in tax reform and legislation. He is also waiting for the completion of the Omnibus Law Bill.
About the shortfall problems that have often occurred, Siddhi suggested Suryo and his staff to do profiling. So, from this step, it can be seen that business sectors are not yet covered and compliance is low and how to approach them.
In addition, he also suggested that the tax revenue target be made based on the figures that had been achieved. "It's not a target to be raised again last year," Siddhi said.
As for Suryo Utomo, the first step to be taken at the beginning of his tenure is to consolidate. "We will consolidate what it will be like," he said after the inauguration at the Ministry of Finance Office.
Suryo said that he would continue the work of the previous Director General of Taxes. However, he will also do the mapping again to see what policies or steps can be accelerated.
In addition, Suryo said the work that must be done in the near future is also to maintain and boost tax sector targets until the end of 2019. "That is what is in front of our eyes, action and effort will be carried out."
In addition, Suryo will also spur the completion of the tax Omnibus Law bill. Currently, the progress of designing the regulation, according to him, there is still harmonization so there are things that need to be rewritten again. He hopes that the discussion and harmonization can be completed immediately before it is delivered to President Joko Widodo. "God willing (finished next year), right we hope that if there are no problems, it can be finished quickly," said Suryo.
